title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement andrew.bruce@northstarrevenueintegrity.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Fee Schedule Calculations
text: Physician Fee Schedule Variables  Physician Fee Schedule Formulas  corresponding GPCI value three components RVU, formula essentially dot product RVU GPCI vectors, multiplied Conversion Factor:  \[ RVU \cdot GPCI = RVU_w(GPCI_w) + RVU_p(GPCI_p) + RVU_m(GPCI_m) \]   Using base r’s matrix multiplication infix operator  Using dot() function {pracma} package
code: wrvu  = 6.26   # Work RVU wgpci = 1      # Work GPCI  pgpci = 0.883  # Practice GPCI prvu  = 4.36   # Practice RVU  mrvu  = 0.99   # Malpractice RVU mgpci = 1.125  # Malpractice GPCI  cf    = 32.744 # Conversion Factor  rvus <- (wrvu * wgpci) + (prvu * pgpci) + (mrvu * mgpci) rvus # Total RVUs #> [1] 11.22363 rvus * cf # Participating Fee #> [1] 367.5065 as.vector(c(wrvu, prvu, mrvu) %*% c(wgpci, pgpci, mgpci)) #> [1] 11.22363 pracma::dot(   c(wrvu, prvu, mrvu),    c(wgpci, pgpci, mgpci)) #> [1] 11.22363 calculate_amounts(   wrvu  = 6.26,   nprvu = 7.92,   fprvu = 4.36,   mrvu  = 0.99,   cf    = 32.744,   wgpci = 1,   pgpci = 0.883,   mgpci = 1.125) |>    tt() |>    format_tt(markdown = TRUE) |>    style_tt(bootstrap_class = "table table-hover")

title: Columns
text: file contains information services covered Medicare Physician Fee Schedule (MPFS) 2024. 10,000 physician services, file contains associated relative value units (RVUs), fee schedule status indicator, various payment policy indicators needed payment adjustment (.e., payment assistant surgery, team surgery, bilateral surgery, etc.). Medicare physician fee schedule amounts adjusted reflect variation practice costs area area. geographic practice cost index (GPCI) established every Medicare payment locality three components procedure’s relative value unit (.e., RVUs work, practice expense, malpractice). GPCIs applied calculation fee schedule payment amount multiplying RVU component times GPCI component. hcpcs HCPCS Code HCPCS Code description Description HCPCS Procedure Description mod Modifier Diagnostic Tests, NA denotes Global Service, Mods 26 & TC identify Components. Mod 53 indicates Separate RVUs & PFS Amount Procedures Terminated Completion. status Status Code Indicates Fee Schedule, Covered, Separately Payable. , R T used Medicare payment. wrvu Work RVU RVUs Physician Work nprvu Non-Facility Practice Expense RVU RVUs Non-Facility Practice Expense fprvu Facility Practice Expense RVU RVUs Facility Practice Expense mrvu Malpractice RVU RVUs Malpractice Expense cf Conversion Factor Multiplier Transforms RVUs Payment Amounts nprvu_opps Non-Facility PE Used OPPS Payment Amount Non-Facility Practice Expense RVUs OPPS Payment fprvu_opps Facility PE Used OPPS Payment Amount Facility Practice Expense RVUs OPPS Payment global Global Days Number Global Days op_ind Operative Percentage Indicator 1 = percentages, 0 = percentages op_pre Preoperative Percentage Preoperative % Global Package op_intra Intraoperative Percentage Intraoperative % Global Package, including Postoperative Work Hospital op_post Postoperative Percentage Postoperative % Global Package, Provided Office, Post-Discharge pctc PCTC Indicator PCTC Payment Adjustment mult_proc Multiple Procedure Indicator Multiple Procedures (Mod 51) Payment Adjustment surg_bilat Bilateral Surgery Indicator Bilateral Procedure (Mod 50) Payment Adjustment surg_asst Assistant Surgery Indicator Assistant Surgery (Mods 80, 81, 82, ) Payment Adjustment surg_co Co-Surgery Indicator Co-surgeons (Mod 62) Payment Adjustment surg_team Team Surgery Indicator Team Surgeons (Mod 66) Payment Adjustment endo Endoscopic Base Code Endoscopic Base Code HCPCS Multiple Surgery indicator 3 supvis Physician Supervision Indicator Physician Supervision Level Required Service dximg Diagnostic Imaging Family Indicator Diagnostic Service Family HCPCS Multiple Procedure indicator 4 unused Used Medicare Payment Whether Code used Medicare Payment rare Rarely/Never Performed Procedure rarely/never performed : 00 (Neither), 01 (Facility), 10 (Non-Facility), 11 ()

text: wrvu <dbl> Work RVU fprvu <dbl> Facility Practice Expense RVU nprvu <dbl> Non-Facility Practice Expense RVU mrvu <dbl> Malpractice RVU wgpci <dbl> Work GPCI pgpci <dbl> Practice Expense GPCI mgpci <dbl> Malpractice GPCI cf <dbl> Conversion Factor, default 32.7442

title: Calculate Physician Fee Schedule Payment Amounts — calculate_amounts
text: list (invisibly) Participating, Non-Participating & Limiting Charge Amounts Facility & Non-Facility RVUs

title: Calculate Physician Fee Schedule Payment Amounts — calculate_amounts
text: ((wRVU x wGPCI) + (pRVU x pGPCI) + (mRVU x mGPCI)) x Conversion Factor

title: Calculate Limiting Charge — limiting_charge
text: However, law sets payment amount Non-participating physicians 95% payment amount Participating physicians (.e., fee schedule amount). Calculating 95% 115% amount equivalent multiplying amount factor 1.0925 (109.25%). Therefore, calculate limiting charge, \(x_{limit}\) physician service locality, multiply fee schedule amount factor 1.0925: $$x_{limit} = \dfrac{\sum_{= 0}^t         \sum_{j = 0}^\infty c_i f_{j - }}{\sum_{= 0} c_i}$$

title: Search Restructured BETOS Classifications — search_rbcs
text: Restructured BETOS Classification System (RBCS) taxonomy allows researchers group Medicare Part B healthcare service codes clinically meaningful categories subcategories. Based original Berenson-Eggers Type Service (BETOS) classification created 1980s, includes notable updates Part B non-physician services undergoes annual updates technical expert panel researchers clinicians. general framework grouping service codes new RBCS taxonomy largely follows structure BETOS. Like BETOS, RBCS groups HCPCS codes categories, subcategories, families – categories aggregate level families granular level. Medicare Part B service codes, including non-physician services, assigned 6-character RBCS taxonomy code.
